Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to grendello/LibZipSharp/master@71f4a94" (#3192) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Changes: https://github.com/grendello/LibZipSharp/compare/da94d3d...71f4a94

I hit an error during a local build on Windows:

    "src\aapt2\aapt2.csproj" (default target) (26:2) ->
    (_DownloadAapt2 target) ->
      src\aapt2\aapt2.targets(49,5): error MSB4018: The "UnzipDirectoryChildren" task failed unexpectedly.
      src\aapt2\aapt2.targets(49,5): error MSB4018: System.AggregateException: One or more errors occurred.
      ---> System.DllNotFoundException: Unable to load DLL 'libzip.dll': The specified module could not be found. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8007007E)

The culprit appeared to be `bin\BuildDebug\libzip.dll` having a
dependency on `zlib.dll`. But we don't even ship `zlib.dll`?

Further investigation, we found `libZipSharp` was using some outdated
NuGet packages for these native libraries on Windows.

In removing the NuGet packages for `libzip.dll` and `zlib.dll` on
Windows, we need to copy the native libraries to `bin\BuildDebug`
during the bootstrap process. I added a new step in `xaprepare` for
this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Auto focus is not working in Xamarin.Android with talk back enabled" (#3076) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Reproducing Sample : Attached in this thread.

1. Enable accessibility feature in android device.
2. Deploy and run the application. 
3. We had set the AutoFocus property of the Button with text Mango to focus that button once the application is launched. But the first button added in the view got focus.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

Button with the text Mango should be focused.

### Actual Behavior

Button with the text Apple should be focused

### Version Information

[spanishSample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3152261/spanishSample.zip)
All Xamarin.Android version

Area: Accessibility, Autofocus

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Updating VS2017 to latest release caused app to enter infinite GC loop when attempting to load" (#2926) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update VS2017 to 15.9.11 - This happens with or without updated Nuget packages for Xamarin.Forms and Xamarin.Android support packages
2. Run application
3. 

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
I expect the app to load

### Actual Behavior
The app enters an infinite loop of the following:
04-04 12:56:26.160 D/Mono    (19621): GC_TAR_BRIDGE bridges 1 objects 1 opaque 0 colors 1 colors-bridged 1 colors-visible 1 xref 0 cache-hit 0 cache-semihit 0 cache-miss 0 setup 0.05ms tarjan 0.00ms scc-setup 0.06ms gather-xref 0.00ms xref-setup 0.00ms cleanup 0.02ms
04-04 12:56:26.160 D/Mono    (19621): GC_BRIDGE: Complete, was running for 11.89ms
04-04 12:56:26.160 D/Mono    (19621): GC_MINOR: (Nursery full) time 11.00ms, stw 12.15ms promoted 396K major size: 1776K in use: 1095K los size: 1024K in use: 80K


It will loop through those messages for as long as I let it sit there doing it, while the screen is black.

Also worth mentioning that this project has not been touched in approximately 6 months, I opened it to make a small change, went to launch the application, and this happened. Leaving the Nuget packages in their ~6 month old versions or updating them to the current versions makes no difference.

It's being caused by animations. There are calls like 'await someImage.FadeTo(1, 2000);'. It looks like these await calls are returning instantly, also causing the screen to go black and an infinite GC loop to occur. Only an Android issue.

### Version Information
Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2017 
Version 15.9.11

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Android Webview does not recognize download links after Chrome 69+ update on Android devices." (#3061) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Webview on Xamarin App with a page which consist a link to a file (pdf for example.)
2. Make sure is Chrome is up-to-date (69+ version) on android device your app is running.
3. Try to click on the file link on that webview, it will do nothing.
4. Now if you uninstall all updates on chrome & go back to 69 or older version of chrome and repeat step-3, it should work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Don't publish bundle on internal Jenkins" (#3212) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/6f238a2b98a4e03b9f8f7a9b84e865c1b515d036

Commit 6f238a2b fixed the xaprepare bootstrapping logic to be able to
download and consume a bundle which was previously built and published
to azure storage. It also exposed a "bug" in xaprepare: when a prebuilt
bundle was downloaded and used, it would no longer also be copied to the
output directory where it would have otherwise been built. Azure Pipeline
and internal Jenkins builds which use a prebuilt bundle broke as a result,
as they attempt to upload a bundle from bin/$Configuration. The Azure
Pipeline breakage was fixed in commit 6f238a2b because subsequent jobs
rely on the bundle being uploaded again. There are no downstream
consumers of the bundle uploaded by internal Jenkins, so there is no need
to continue to upload it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Resolve fallback type before trying to make constructed generic type" (#6511) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

The `FallbackTypeResolver` hander in the Forms previewer does not have access to the `x:TypeArguments` attribute, so if it constructs a proxy generic type from metadata it can't construct it. So the previewer has to create an unconstructed generic type, and Forms will need to construct it.

So we need to move the code that constructs the generic type after the call to `FallbackTypeResolver`.

### Issues Resolved ### 

Part of the fix for https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/917689

### API Changes ###
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
- Core/XAML (all platforms)

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
Testing requires previewer code that isn't yet merged.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix some flaky tests." (#6510) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Found issues on some tests when running on my local machine.

### Description of Change ###
The test Bugzilla31333 dont wait the input to take focus (so on a fast machine it fail).
The test Issue1733 use the current culture to parse number which can fail (and indeed fail with my machine culture).

### Issues Resolved ### 
- Fix test Bugzilla31333
- Fix test Issue1733

### API Changes ###
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
- Run test Bugzilla31333
- Run test Issue1733

### PR Checklist ###
- [X] Has automated tests
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [X] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[foundation] Fix NSCopying.Copy - the biggest offender of not releasing its return value" (#6271) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[Xharness] Do use the traits provided by the mono sdk." (#6160) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Rather than hardcoding the tests ignored categories and traits, use the
ones that are provided by the mono sdk for each runner.

Ps: created as a draft because I believe that there is a mismatch between the traits/categories present in mono and the ones we are using. We have some missing which will result in tests failing.
